column4: ok i need help with a pcmcia sound card, can does anyone know how to install it? (using feisty)? i can wait, just need to know if some1 can help..
First off I would plug it in, it may "just work"
it's plugged in (and worked gerat with XP) but xp sxs..
look at alsamixer to see if you can see the channel at least
how can i check the alsamixer?
Use arrow keys to change volume / channel and the "m" key to mute / unmute
the problem is that i have an internal sound card aswell (realtek crap) and an addisional SB2 notebook pcmcia (i can only see the realtek in alsamixer)
I have never used a pcmcia card so I am basically trying to figure this out along with you, just so you know :) Have you tried booting with it in?
haven't tested it out yet, i should do this right "sudo apt-get install asoundconf-gtk" right?
i'll try to logout + in and see if there is any difference..
when i do a "tail -2 /proc/asound/oss/sndstat" i get 0. Realtek ALC202 rev 0   and 1.1: Silicon Laboratory Si3036,8 rev
(Preferences>Sound) does not properly switch sound cards, is there another way to do this?
it worked !!! just needed a proper restart
